dt: {bc}a mineral consisting of a massive usually layered calcium carbonate (such as aragonite or calcite) formed by deposition from spring waters or especially from hot springs

et: French {it}travertin{/it}, from Italian {it}travertino, trevertino{/it}, from Latin {it}tiburtinus{/it}, adjective, of travertine, literally, of Tibur (Tivoli)
shortdef: a mineral consisting of a massive usually layered calcium carbonate (such as aragonite or calcite) formed by deposition from spring waters or especially from hot springs
